channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 large potholes on entrance to the Sixways clinic car park, near the street, 23rd August
item.description:
The road leading to the car park of Sixways clinic and to Ashley Manor Prep School, just at the entrance when turning in off of the A40, there are two very large and quite deep pot holes that cannot be avoided. I thought I'd damaged my tyre/wheel yesterday thudding into them - but I hadn't. However I feel sure that people are going to damage their vehicles here if these are not fixed soon
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashley Road, Battledown, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole (possibly from collapsed manhole cover), 23rd August
item.description:
The pothole is on Tewkesbury Road, next to the KFC, as youâ€™re heading towards town. It seemed like it might have been caused by a collapsed drain cover, as it has been getting progressively worse and wetter recently, and is near to the curb.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Reinstatement work sunken. Buses going over the strip cause a massive bang which vibrates the building. Noise and movement excessive. Reported earlier in the month but case has been closed and no contact has been made with me, 23rd August

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 23rd August
item.description:
Email received 23/08/2024 - copy attached. Customer reports that the pavement at the location is in a state of poor repair and is potentially dangerous to their mother who uses a walker for mobility purposes. They ask if repairs could be undertaken to make it safe.

item.title: Traffic light on Telstar Way, to join the A40, keeps getting stuck on red for very long periods, 23rd August
item.description:
Telstar Way, heading onto the A40. There is no option to turn around or reverse, so to avoid being stuck at the light for hours/days, traffic has no option but to jump the red light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Telstar Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 23rd August
item.description:
email rcvd 23.08.24 - Good morning, Would it please be possible to look into the pedestrian crossing on Honeybourne way, halfway up the hill next to St. James Walk. It is very loud even with the windows shut. When needing to have the windows open during hot weather it is a major disturbance. There are a number of alternatives to assist people with crossing that do not create so much noise pollution.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd August
item.description:
20/08/24 enquiry rcvd (trail to date attached) - Hi I live in Bishop's Cleeve. And the trees that are on the land next to mine are now getting to be a problem. They are growing tall and overflowing into our garden. I have been in touch with Tewkesbury borough council and have been advised this is your area. Can someone be in touch to advise what can be done as they need to be trimmed back and down.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge yellow sign saying Road is to be closed on August 3rd ( I think), 22nd August

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Andoversford, Cotswold
